intro: Lophiolepis phyllocephala, commonly known as the broad-leaved lophiolepis, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, with colors ranging from purple to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly seen in its natural habitat.
